data.title: German Authority Opens Probe Into Amazon, Apple Over Alleged Anticompetition
data.text: German antitrust regulators are investigating both Amazon and Apple over possible anticompetitive behavior in the country, according to German Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, quoted by Reuters. Germany is looking into whether Amazon is allowed to ban some third-party competitors from offering certain branded products on its eCommerce site, Reuters reported.

data.title: Here's how tech's most valuable companies have performed under Trump
data.text: Tech's five biggest companies all report earnings this week, giving investors one last look at results before next week's election.

data.title: Tech giants lost more than $270 billion in market value in the last two days
data.text: Big Tech companies lost a collective $273 billion in value over the past two days, as the broader market sank due to a global surge in Covid-19 cases.

data.title: Apple search crawler activity could signal a Google competitor, or a bid to make Siri a one-stop-shop
data.text: Encouraged by the spate of antitrust activity brewing in both the Justice Department and on Capitol Hill, Apple may be developing a search competitor to Google, according to a report in the Financial Times. That would be a move ripe with irony as the push for an end to anti-competitive practices is seemingly creating greater […]

data.title: Economic cost of new EU tech rules could top $100.5 billion, study says
data.text: The European Union's plan to rein in U.S. tech giants with new rules could cost the 27-country bloc as much as 85 billion euros ($100.5 billion) in economic growth, Brussels-based think tank ECIPE warned.

data.title: Apple's new iPhone 12 may have secret wireless charging feature
data.text: The iPhone 12 may have a secret new feature that allows it to wirelessly charge other devices. The recently-released phone “supports a built-in inductive charging transmitter and receiver,” according to new FCC filings, which would imply that the phone's battery would be able to give juice to other electronics that are compatible with wireless charging.

data.title: Apple Develops Its Own Search Tools as Google Defends Against Antitrust Probe
data.text: The question is whether Apple is looking to compete or to have an alternative ready at hand.

data.title: Top Stocks To Buy Today As Nasdaq Plunges
data.text: Stocks are set to sink again today amid fears of a record surge in COVID cases. If more lockdown measures are put in place over the next few weeks without a stimulus, further volatility can be expected.

data.title: Apple Notches Record iPhone 12, iPhone 12 Pro Preorders In India
data.text: Apple Inc.'s (NASDAQ: AAPL) recently launched 5G-capable iPhone iteration is gaining traction, lending credence to the sell-side view that the biggest supercycle since the 2014 launch of iPhone 6 is underway. What Happened: Buoyed by exciting promotional offers, preorders for Apple's iPhone 12 and iPhone 12 Pro in India have broken previous records, iMore.com said, citing a IANS report that quoted trade sources.

data.title: Apple In 5 Charts
data.text: A quick and easy visual guide to what makes Apple a powerhouse growth stock.

data.title: Apple is reportedly looking to develop its own search engine
data.text: Apple is reportedly ramping up efforts to develop its own search engine, even as federal regulators have its lucrative search agreement with Google in their crosshairs. The iPhone maker has begun showing its own search results and links to websites when users enter a query directly on the phone's home screen, the Financial Times reports.

data.title: 2 Major Catalysts to Watch When Apple Reports Q4 Earnings
data.text: Apple reports fiscal Q4 earnings on Oct. 29. Look for information about Services growth and iPhone 12 sales to drive AAPL stock.

data.title: Why Earnings Season Could Be Great for Apple (AAPL)
data.text: Apple (AAPL) is seeing favorable earnings estimate revision activity and has a positive Zacks Earnings ESP heading into earnings season.

data.title: Apple is quietly building a search rival to Google ahead of the DOJ's landmark antitrust case, according to a report
data.text: Apple is quietly building a rival to Google's ubiquitous search engine, the Financial Times reported Wednesday, just as the US Department of Justice's (DOJ) landmark antitrust suit aims to break Google's grip on worldwide search queries. Users who downloaded iOS 14, the latest iPhone operating system, noticed that Apple now shows its own results when users search on their home screen. Clicking on links takes users directly to the website in question, rather than through another search engine.

data.title: 1 Billion Reasons to Buy Apple Stock
data.text: An independent analyst estimates that the iPhone installed base has hit a major milestone.

data.title: Apple Is Reportedly Creating Its Own Search Engine Amid Google's Antitrust Woes
data.text: The search engine giant's relationship with Apple faces renewed scrutiny with U.S. antitrust investigations.

data.title: Apple Advances Quest To Conquer Google Search
data.text: Apple is rumored to be going after a piece of the lucrative search market and is said to be developing technology to topple Google's reign, a Financial Times (FT) report indicated on Wednesday (Oct. 28), citing familiar sources. Advancing its own search ingenuity is a turning point for Apple's in-house development, industry sources told FT.

data.title: Apple Buys Spain's Vilynx For $50M To Use AI On Apps
data.text: Apple has acquired Barcelona's Vilynx, which works in advanced artificial intelligence that could boost the iPhone's AI across various devices, Bloomberg reports. Apple acquired Vilynx earlier this year, according to people familiar with the issue, Bloomberg reports.

data.title: Here's Why Apple Paid $50 Million for an AI Video Startup
data.text: The iPhone maker is working to improve its artificial intelligence pedigree.

data.title: Apple Works On Its Own Search Engine As Regulators Turn Up Heat On Google Deal: FT
data.text: Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) is ramping up efforts to develop its own search technology amid a backdrop of antitrust scrutiny over its relationship with Google parent Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG), the Financial Times reported Wednesday. What Happened: The development would cast a shadow on the multibillion-dollar payments that the search engine giant makes to the Tim Cook-led company, according to FT.
